Super hydrating. I highly recommend the TBT creme has really rich ingredients. I wake up looking rested, and plumper.

reviews.headline: Hydrating and delicate
reviews.comments: My combination skin loves this cream. It goes on HEAVY, like over heavy, but its temporary. After an hour or so, for me at least, it all absorbs quickly, even in heat. Big fan

reviews.headline: Rich PM moisturizer
reviews.comments: I've been using this off and on for a several months and have enjoyed it. I have mostly normal skin with a few small dryer patches. This has been the last step in my nightly routine and it works nicely on top of my other products (toner and retinol serum.) It's rich, ultra moisturizing and leaves my skin with a nice glow. I wake up with very soft, smooth skin. Because it is quite thick, it may not be great for people with oily skin. Since we're heading into summer, I will be switching to something more lightweight, but I could see myself purchasing this again, come winter.

reviews.headline: The best night cream!
reviews.comments: I use this and the facial oil from Dime every night. I wake up with glowy skin and improvement in any blemishes I may have

reviews.headline: Favorite Product
reviews.comments:
I have no idea how many of these I have gone through at this point, but I will always keep it as part of my night time skin care routine!
I have such sensitive and dry skin and this product will calm and hydrate over night. It's my holy grail! 
I always put on a good layer on my face before i got to bed, and my skin just drinks it up. I wake up with hydrated and plump skin. Cant say enough about how great it is!

reviews.headline: Great for Sensitive Skin!
reviews.comments: I am randomly allergic to a few different things that make my skin breakout in large itchy red patches, and when that happens, even a lot of sensitive skin products make it burn, but this moisturizer never has!

reviews.headline: Not Great for Sensitive Skin
reviews.comments: I was looking for a night cream replacement for my Beautycounter products, and thought this would be a great alternative. However, something in this product keeps causing a reaction on my skin. Back on the hunt I go.

reviews.headline: Smell not pleasant
reviews.comments: I used it 3 times then threw it out. I couldn't stand the smell, it literally smelled like chemicals. It was a decent moisturizer.

reviews.headline: So far so good
reviews.comments: We're about 2 weeks in and so far, I'm loving it. It's thick and creamy but not greasy. I put it on at bed and wash it off in the morning and my skin looks dewy and hydrated. I'm 38, so that's no small feat. I also have sensitive skin and eczema but I haven't had problems with this product. I'm thrilled that there's no specific scent to it. I'm hoping to continue seeing great results. It hasn't made me break out like many other moisturizers, either.

reviews.headline: Sits on Skin
reviews.comments: I wanted to love this but I don't. The cream is super greasy, doesn't absorb and pills. I may be the only one experiencing this since there are so many great reviews. I have tried this several times with different serums and no matter what I use, it will not absorb into my skin. It also pills if I touch my face. It reminds me of the peeling gels that pull off dead skin cells. I'm not sure what I'm going to do with the rest of the jar but I won't be using it on my face. There are many other great night creams out there so I'll keep using Perricone, Kora Organics and Clarins.

reviews.headline: Gave me a rash
reviews.comments: I should've known when it burned a bit upon application but the reviews were so good I made the mistake of sticking with it and it caused me to get a pretty bad case of perioral dermatitis. Maybe it is good for others, but def not for me :(

reviews.headline: Love this and will buy again!
reviews.comments: I have dry sensitive skin with rosacea. I was looking for a night cream with ceramides in it that would be soothing and have anti-inflammatory properties. My 46 year old skin loves this. I've purchased this 3 times so far. It has not caused me any breakouts and does a great job with hydration.

reviews.headline: Not a favorite
reviews.comments: Am i the only one not crazy about this cream? I understand its a night cream, but it feels so thick and heavy on my face. Immediately my face feels like it cant breathe. This mixed with postpartum night sweats is the worst combo.

reviews.headline: Awful smell
reviews.comments: Smells like a bonfire in the worst way. Even if the benefits turned out to be decent, i dont think it would be worth it to have to stomach the smell.

reviews.headline: AI gives it the thumbs up!
reviews.comments: Ive been searching for a good moisturizer and plugging the ingredients into chat AI. Usually it lists a few potentially harmful ingredients but this with this moisturizer it said that there are none!

reviews.headline: Terrible smell
reviews.comments: It smells awful almost like rubber. I havent used it on my face and i most likely wont bc of the smell. im afraid its going to irritate my skin so im not even going to bother using.

reviews.headline: Dime, love it
reviews.comments: I will definitely  be buying again. Leaves My skin feeling so soft and vibrant. I can definitely  see my skin slowly improving.

reviews.headline: Work hard to prepare your skin at night
reviews.comments: I been using this for 3 weeks now.. since using retinol, acne treatment and hyperpigmentation spot treatment. I need something heavy duty to hydrate my skin. This cream does it. And its not greasy: no scent that i notice

reviews.headline: Smells awful!
reviews.comments: I'm not faint hearted about funky scents but the smell of this cream takes it to a whole new level! I can't quite pinpoint what it smells like except, maybe burnt skin or hair?? Gross!! If it wasn't for the smell, I'd use it to see if I got any good results but I really can't get over the offensive scent.

faceoff_positive.comments: As someone who values a good night-time skincare routine, I can honestly say that Dime Beauty Restorative Night Cream has become a staple in my routine. This cream is packed with high-quality ingredients that work together to nourish, hydrate, and repair the skin while I sleep. What I love most about this night cream is its ability to provide deep hydration to my skin. The texture is rich and creamy, but it doesn't feel heavy or greasy on my skin. Instead, it absorbs quickly and leaves my skin feeling soft, supple, and well-hydrated. Another thing I appreciate about this night cream is its ability to improve the overall appearance of my skin. It contains a blend of natural ingredients like shea butter, jojoba oil, and vitamin E that work together to repair and rejuvenate the skin. After using it consistently for several weeks, I noticed a significant improvement in the texture and firmness of my skin. I also love that this night cream is free from harsh chemicals and artificial fragrances. It's gentle on the skin and doesn't cause any irritation or breakouts. And the subtle, natural scent is really pleasant and relaxing, which is perfect for winding down before bed. Overall, I highly recommend Dime Beauty Restorative Night Cream to anyone looking for a high-quality, hydrating night cream that delivers real results. With regular use, you'll notice smoother, more youthful-looking skin that feels soft, supple, and well-nourished. It's definitely worth giving a try!
